A big shift is happening in how we build software. The move from traditional request/response patterns to an agentic execution loop fundamentally changes what apps can do. Instead of singlestep prompts, we now have systems that can plan, reason, call tools, and iterate until a task is complete. The GitHub Copilot SDK is a major unlock here. It brings the same productiongrade runtime that powers Copilot CLImultimodel orchestration, multistep planning, tool calling, MCP integration, secure auth, and streamingdirectly into any application. That means developers can embed autonomous workflows without reinventing the entire agent stack. This is the beginning of a new app paradigm where agents arent addons, but core execution units.

Previously, the developer was responsible for both the Architecture (The What) and the Implementation (The How). With this new paradigm, the developer becomes the 'Orchestrator'defining the parameterswhile the Agent handles the granular execution. We aren't just writing apps anymore; we are compiling Logic Flows. A massive leap for the developer experience.
